pkg-dir

Find the root directory of a npm package

Install

$ npm install --save pkg-dir

Usage

/ └── Users └── sindresorhus └── foo ├── package.json └── bar ├── baz └── example.js

```js // example.js var pkgDir = require(‘pkg-dir’);

pkgDir(__dirname).then(function (rootPath) { console.log(rootPath); //=> ‘/Users/sindresorhus/foo’ }); ```

API

pkgDir([cwd])

Returns a promise that resolves to the package root path or null.

pkgDir.sync([cwd])

Returns the package root path or null.

cwd

Type: string
Default: process.cwd()

Directory to start from.

Related

  • pkg-dir-cli - CLI for this module
  • find-up - Find a file by walking up parent directories
